headline: Sempra (SRE) Margin Decline Reinforces Questions on Premium Valuation and Slower Growth Prospects
summary: Sempra (SRE) reported earnings growth that averaged 13.5% per year over the past five years. However, this past year saw a reversal, with net profit margins dropping to 20% from 22.1% previously and earnings growth slipping into negative territory, making year-over-year comparisons less favorable. The company is forecast to grow earnings at 10.08% annually going forward, while revenues are expected to rise by 2.8% per year. This rate trails the broader US market’s average of 10.5%. Investors...
